intro: Yeatesia, commonly known as the "false holly," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Rubiaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are shrubs or small trees native to tropical and subtropical regions. The plants typically have opposite, simple leaves and produce small, clustered flowers with four or five petals. The fruits are usually berries that contain one or two seeds. Yeatesia species are often found in moist, shaded habitats and are valued for their ornamental appeal.
